summary: A full-featured car enthusiast social media app inspired by Instagram/TikTok, built exclusively for car culture under the brand 'RevGrid'. Includes a feed, reels, follow/unfollow system, direct messaging, user profiles, mechanics help section, build showcases with photos, a marketplace for buying/selling car parts, car meet events, likes, comments, a discovery page, the ability for users to delete their own posts and reels, and an About RevGrid page with platform description, support/donation info, and contact details.
architectural_notes: Social media platform exclusively for car culture â€” Instagram-inspired UI/UX
Core entities: Users, Posts, Reels, Comments, Likes, Follows, Messages, Events, Builds
Media-heavy app requiring image and video upload/storage support
App has a gated landing page â€” users must press login before accessing the main app
Marketplace entity needed: listings (id, sellerId, title, description, price, imageUrls, category, status, createdAt)
Reels support category tags: Street, Stance, JDM, Drift, and other car culture subgenres â€” stored on the post/reel entity
Larger media uploads may require chunked upload strategy or asset canister (ICP) to bypass the ~2 MB ingress message limit

The image must be wrapped in an anchor tag with target='_blank' and rel='noopener noreferrer'.

new_feature_requests.summary: Car photo/video feed with likes and comments
Reels-style short video feature for car content
Follow/unfollow system between users
Direct messaging (chat) between users
User profiles with car info and posts
Mechanics help section for Q&A and advice
Build showcase pages with photo galleries
Car meet events page for browsing and posting events
Discovery/explore page for finding users and content
Bug checking and fixes across all features

Implement a backend data model and actor supporting: users (id, username, displayName, bio, profilePicUrl, carInfo, followersCount, followingCount, createdAt), posts (id, authorId, imageUrl, caption, tags, likesCount, commentsCount, createdAt, postType: 'feed' | 'reel' | 'build' | 'mechanic'), comments (id, postId, authorId, text, createdAt), likes (userId, postId), follows (followerId, followeeId), messages (id, senderId, receiverId, text, createdAt), events (id, organizerId, title, description, location, date, imageUrl, attendeesCount), and buildShowcases (id, authorId, title, description, imageUrls, specs, createdAt). Provide full CRUD operations for all entities.

Implement a mock/demo user session system (no Internet Identity required for demo) that pre-populates the app with at least 6 realistic demo users with car profiles, 15+ demo posts across all content types (feed, reels, builds, mechanic Q&A), 3 demo events, and several follows/messages. This allows the app to be immediately usable and visually rich on first load.
Add a landing/login page with a login button that gates access to the app, featuring a modified import car as the background image
Add an aftermarket car parts advertisement/link on each page pointing to https://ebay.com/inf/revreel?mkcid=1&mkrid=711-53200-19255-0&siteid=0&campid=5339143418&toolid=80008&mkevt=1
Rename the app display name shown at the top of the page from 'CarGram' to 'RevReel' (or the preferred rev-related name)
Add a Marketplace page where users can list, browse, and inquire about car parts and vehicles for sale
Allow users to delete their own posts and reels from the feed, reels page, and their profile

Add a Marketplace page where users can create, browse, and view listings for car parts and vehicles for sale. Each listing card shows: seller avatar, username, item title, price, condition, description, at least one image (via URL input), and a contact/inquiry button. Include a 'Create Listing' button that opens a form with fields for title, description, price, condition (new/used), category (parts/wheels/audio/exterior/interior/other), and image URL. Listings are persisted in the backend. Add a 'Marketplace' tab or entry point accessible from the bottom navigation or Discover page.

Extend the backend data model to support marketplace listings with fields: id, authorId, title, description, price (text), condition ('new' | 'used'), category (text), imageUrl, createdAt, and a sold flag. Expose CRUD operations: createListing, getListing, getAllListings, updateListing, deleteListing (owner only).

Add delete functionality to posts and reels: on each post card in the Home Feed, and on each reel in the Reels page, show a delete button (e.g., a trash icon or a three-dot menu option) that is only visible to the post's author. When tapped, prompt for confirmation, then call the backend delete function and remove the post from the UI. Also surface this delete option on the user's own profile page tabs (Posts, Reels, Builds).
Expose a deletePost function in the backend that accepts a post ID, verifies the caller is the post's author, and permanently removes the post record (and associated likes/comments if applicable).

Enhance the existing Mechanics Help page (MechanicsPage.tsx and MechanicThreadPage.tsx) to support image attachments on questions: add an optional image URL field to the CreateMechanicQuestionPage form, display the image on the question thread page when present, and show a car model/year field on the creation form.

Enhance the existing Build Showcase section: update the CreateBuildPage form to support multiple image URLs (allow adding/removing image URL inputs dynamically, minimum 1, up to 6). Display all images in a swipeable carousel on the BuildDetailPage. Add a delete button on build cards visible only to the build's author.

Add a 'Marketplace' navigation entry to the BottomNav or the CreatePostSheet so users can easily access the Marketplace page. Update the route in App.tsx to include the /marketplace route. Add a 'List Item for Sale' option in the CreatePostSheet bottom sheet alongside the existing four content types.
Add a follow/unfollow button prominently on the user profile page, and restrict direct messaging (chat) so that users can only message each other if they follow one another (followers-only chat).

Expose a backend query in main.mo that returns the list of principal IDs that a given user follows (getFollowing) and the list of principal IDs that follow a given user (getFollowers), if not already available. Also ensure a query exists to check whether the current caller follows a specific user (isFollowing). These are needed to power the followers-only chat restriction and the follow button state on the profile page.
Allow users to upload their own videos/reels and profile pictures (actual file upload, not just URL input)
Add reel category/tag selection when creating a reel â€” options like Street, Stance, JDM, Drift, etc. Display the category on the reel.

Extend the backend Post data model to include an optional `reelCategory` field (text) on posts of type `reel`. Add or update the `createPost` function to accept this optional field. Store reel categories such as 'Street', 'Stance', 'JDM', 'Drift', 'Build', 'Show', 'Track', 'Import' alongside the post record.

Extend the backend UserProfile data model to include a `profilePicData` field for storing uploaded profile picture content (as Blob or base64-encoded text). Add an `updateProfilePic` function that accepts the image data and updates the caller's profile picture, replacing the existing URL-only approach.

Extend the backend Post data model to support storing uploaded media data (image or video as base64-encoded text or Blob) directly on the post record alongside the existing imageUrl field. Update createPost to accept an optional mediaData field. For reel posts, allow video data to be stored. Ensure deletePost (already implemented) also removes associated media data.

Verify and reinforce that the backend `deletePost` function correctly handles all post types (feed, reel, build, mechanic) â€” it must verify the caller is the post's author before deleting, and remove associated likes and comments from state maps along with the post record.
Add a search feature for reels â€” allow users to search for reels by category/interest tags (JDM, Drift, Stance, etc.) and by username, displaying matching reels in a searchable results view.

Add a backend query `searchReels` that accepts a search string and returns all posts of type `reel` whose `reelCategory` (case-insensitive) or author's username/displayName contains the search string. The function must be callable by authenticated users and return the same Post record shape already used by other post queries.

Extend the backend UserProfile data model in backend/main.mo to include a `profilePicData` field (as ?Text) for storing base64-encoded profile picture data. Add an `updateProfilePic` function that accepts the base64 image string and updates the caller's profile record. Ensure that all profile query functions return the `profilePicData` field so the frontend can render it as the user's avatar.

Audit the backend createPost function in backend/main.mo for any conditions that could cause it to trap (panic) rather than return a structured error â€” such as: out-of-bounds array access, division by zero, assertion failures, or calls to Debug.trap. Replace any such traps with graceful #err result variants so that the frontend always receives a response and is never left awaiting an unresolved call.
Fix missing Discovery/Explore page â€” the page is not rendering or accessible from the bottom navigation
Ensure the Discover page (frontend/src/pages/DiscoverPage.tsx) is correctly registered as a route in frontend/src/App.tsx at the path '/discover' and is fully accessible to authenticated users.

Verify that DiscoverPage (frontend/src/pages/DiscoverPage.tsx) renders correctly: it must display a search bar, suggested users with follow buttons, and a tabbed content grid (All, Builds, Reels, Mechanics, Events). Fix any runtime errors, broken imports, or missing data-fetching hooks that prevent the page from rendering.

Ensure the backend `main.mo` actor exposes full marketplace listing CRUD: `createListing` (accepts title, description, price as Text, condition as 'new'|'used', category as Text, imageUrl as Text), `getAllListings` (returns all listings), `getListing` (returns a single listing by ID), `deleteListing` (owner-only, removes the listing record). Each listing record must include: id (Nat), authorId (Principal), title, description, price, condition, category, imageUrl, createdAt (Int nanoseconds), and a sold flag (Bool). If this data model already exists in main.mo, verify it is complete and fix any missing fields or functions.
Increase the file size limit for reel/video uploads to support larger files and longer reels beyond the current ~2 MB cap

Update the backend createPost function in backend/main.mo to accept larger mediaData payloads. Ensure the Text field used to store base64-encoded media data on post records does not impose an artificially low size cap, and that the function does not trap or return an error for media payloads up to the ICP ingress message limit (~2 MB per call). If chunked or asset canister storage is not feasible, document the effective limit in a comment but ensure the frontend and backend limits are consistent so users are not shown conflicting errors.
Increase the caption text size and related text sizes (username, tags, etc.) on the Reels page so they are larger and more readable

Create an About RevGrid page displaying the platform description, feature highlights, support/donation info (Cash App: $alteredsol), and contact info (Instagram: @boddysum), styled with the app's dark automotive theme.

Increase the maximum allowed file/media upload size across all post creation flows â€” feed posts, reels, build showcases, and mechanic questions â€” to accept larger images and videos beyond the current cap

Update the backend createPost function in backend/main.mo to ensure it does not trap or return an error for mediaData (base64-encoded text) payloads up to the ICP ingress message limit (~2 MB per call). Remove any artificial size cap or assertion on the mediaData or imageUrl Text fields. Add a comment documenting the effective payload limit. This ensures the backend is consistent with the increased frontend file size limits.

Create a Tuner Shop page for 'Altered Imports' â€” a performance automotive shop specializing in Honda/Acura platforms. Page must display: shop description/mission, list of services (Honda & Acura Performance, Custom Engine Swaps, Full & Partial Engine Rebuilds, Custom Modifications, ECU Chipping & Engine Management, Dyno Tuning & Street Tuning, Transmission Rebuilds & Drivetrain Services), closing tagline 'Build different. Build altered.', location (Wenatchee), and contact info (Instagram: @mr.altered, Phone: 509-679-1389). Styled with the app's dark asphalt/amber automotive theme.

Audit the backend main.mo actor for any startup-time traps â€” such as top-level expressions, initializer blocks, or pre/post-upgrade hooks â€” that could cause the canister to fail to respond to queries, resulting in the frontend hanging on load. Ensure the actor initializes cleanly without trapping, and that all stable variable declarations and upgrade hooks are safe.

Ensure the uploaded profile picture (stored as base64 in the backend profilePicData field) is displayed throughout the app wherever the user's avatar is rendered: ProfilePage header, PostCard author avatar, CommentsSheet comment avatars, UserListItem avatar, and ReelsPage overlay username/avatar. When profilePicData is present on a user record, use it as the src (as a data URL); fall back to the existing placeholder/initials avatar when it is absent.

Verify that the backend `updateProfilePic` function in backend/main.mo accepts a base64-encoded image string (?Text), stores it in the caller's UserProfile record under the `profilePicData` field, and is returned by all profile query functions (getProfile, getUserProfile, etc.) so the frontend can render it. If the function or field is missing or incomplete, add or fix it.
Add cover photo upload on the profile page (similar to profile picture upload)
Add hashtag pages â€” tap a hashtag on any post to see all posts with that tag
Add a trending/popular posts section on the Discover page
Add a Save/Bookmark feature so users can save posts to view later
Add a 'Sold' button so marketplace sellers can mark listings as sold
Add a listing detail page with full description and contact options for the Marketplace
Allow multiple images per marketplace listing
Add an RSVP/attending list on events so users can see who else is going
Add a filter by upcoming vs. past events on the Events page
Add pull-to-refresh on the home feed
Add a notification badge on the Messages icon when there are unread messages
Add loading skeletons instead of spinners for a smoother feel across the app
Add the ability to mark a mechanic question as 'Solved' on the Mechanics Help section
Add upvote/helpful buttons on mechanic question answers
Show a 'Suggested Users' panel on the home feed

Add cover photo upload to the Profile page (frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx). When the current user views their own profile, display a camera/edit icon overlay on the cover photo area. Tapping it opens a native file input (accepts image/*, max 10 MB). Encode the selected image as base64 and call a backend `updateCoverPhoto` function to persist it. Display the uploaded cover photo as the profile header background wherever the user's profile is rendered.

Add a backend `updateCoverPhoto` function in backend/main.mo that accepts a base64-encoded image string (?Text), stores it in the caller's UserProfile record under a `coverPhotoData` field (?Text), and ensures all profile query functions (getProfile, getUserProfile, etc.) return the `coverPhotoData` field.

Add hashtag pages to the app. In PostCard (frontend/src/components/PostCard.tsx) and on any surface where hashtags/tags are rendered (ReelsPage, BuildDetailPage, MechanicThreadPage), make each hashtag a tappable link that navigates to a new HashtagPage at the route `/hashtag/:tag`. Create `frontend/src/pages/HashtagPage.tsx` that fetches and displays all posts whose tags include the given hashtag in a scrollable grid/list, styled with the dark asphalt/amber automotive theme.

Add a backend query `getPostsByTag` in backend/main.mo that accepts a tag string and returns all posts (across all post types) whose tags array contains that tag (case-insensitive match). Return the same Post record shape used by other post queries.

Add a 'Trending Posts' section to the Discover page (frontend/src/pages/DiscoverPage.tsx). Display a horizontally scrollable row or a dedicated section at the top of the page showing the top trending posts (sorted by likes count descending). Each card in the trending section shows the post thumbnail, like count, and author username. Fetch trending posts via a `useGetTrendingPosts` React Query hook that calls the backend `getTrendingPosts` function.

Add a backend query `getTrendingPosts` in backend/main.mo that returns the top N posts (e.g., top 20) sorted by likesCount descending across all post types. Return the same Post record shape used by other post queries.

Add a Save/Bookmark feature. On every PostCard (frontend/src/components/PostCard.tsx), add a bookmark icon button alongside the existing like/comment/share buttons. Tapping it toggles the saved state for the current user. Create a `frontend/src/pages/BookmarksPage.tsx` page that lists all posts the current user has saved, accessible via a new route `/bookmarks`. Add a 'Bookmarks' entry point from the Profile page when viewing the current user's own profile.

Add bookmark/save backend support in backend/main.mo: a `bookmarks` stable data structure mapping userId to a set of postIds. Expose `toggleBookmark(postId: Nat): async Result<Bool, Text>` (returns true if now bookmarked, false if removed) and `getBookmarks(): async [Post]` that returns all bookmarked posts for the caller.

Add a 'Sold' button to marketplace listing cards on MarketplacePage (frontend/src/pages/MarketplacePage.tsx). The button is only visible to the listing's author. Tapping it calls a backend `markListingSold` mutation and updates the listing card to show a 'SOLD' badge overlay. Sold listings remain visible in the marketplace grid but are clearly marked as sold.

Add a backend `markListingSold` function in backend/main.mo that accepts a listing ID, verifies the caller is the listing's author, sets the `sold` flag to true on the listing record, and returns a Result<(), Text>.

Create a Listing Detail page at `frontend/src/pages/ListingDetailPage.tsx`. The page displays the full listing: all images (in a swipeable gallery if multiple, or a single image), title, price, condition badge, category, full description, seller avatar and username (linking to their profile), and a 'Contact Seller' button that opens the chat thread with the seller (navigating to `/chat/:sellerId`). Register the route in App.tsx at `/marketplace/:id`. Make listing cards on MarketplacePage tappable, navigating to this detail page.

Allow multiple images per marketplace listing. Update CreateListingPage (frontend/src/pages/CreateListingPage.tsx) to support up to 4 image file inputs (dynamically add/remove). Encode each selected image as base64. Update the backend `createListing` function to accept an array of image data strings (`imageUrls: [Text]`) instead of a single imageUrl. Update ListingDetailPage to display all images in a swipeable carousel.

Add an RSVP attendees list to the Event Detail page (frontend/src/pages/EventDetailPage.tsx). Below the 'I'm Attending' button, display a list of user avatars and usernames of attendees who have RSVPed. Fetch the attendees list via a `useGetEventAttendees` React Query hook calling the backend `getEventAttendees` function. Show the count and the first N avatars in a row, with a 'See all' option if there are more than 5.

Add a backend `getEventAttendees` function in backend/main.mo that accepts an event ID and returns the list of UserProfile records for all users who have marked attendance for that event. Track attendees in a stable data structure mapping eventId to a list of principal IDs.

Add upcoming vs. past event filters to the Events page (frontend/src/pages/EventsPage.tsx). Add two filter tabs or toggle buttons: 'Upcoming' and 'Past'. 'Upcoming' shows events whose date is in the future; 'Past' shows events whose date has already passed. Default to the 'Upcoming' tab. Apply filtering on the client side using the event's date field.

Replace all loading spinners in the app with skeleton loading screens for a smoother feel. Add skeleton components to: HomePage (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) feed, DiscoverPage (frontend/src/pages/DiscoverPage.tsx) grid, MarketplacePage (frontend/src/pages/MarketplacePage.tsx) listing grid, ProfilePage (frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx) profile header and content tabs, and BuildsPage (frontend/src/pages/BuildsPage.tsx) grid. Skeletons should use the app's asphalt color palette with a subtle shimmer/pulse animation.

Add a 'Mark as Solved' button to mechanic question threads on MechanicThreadPage (frontend/src/pages/MechanicThreadPage.tsx). The button is only visible to the question's author. Tapping it calls a backend `markQuestionSolved` mutation and updates the thread header to display a green 'SOLVED' badge. Solved questions also show a 'SOLVED' badge on the question list in MechanicsPage.

Add a backend `markQuestionSolved` function in backend/main.mo that accepts a post ID, verifies the caller is the post's author and the post is of type `mechanic`, sets a `solved` flag (Bool) on the post record to true, and returns a Result<(), Text>. Ensure the `solved` field is included in the Post record type and returned by all post query functions.

Add upvote/helpful buttons on answers (comments) in the mechanic question thread on MechanicThreadPage (frontend/src/pages/MechanicThreadPage.tsx). Each answer (comment) displays a thumbs-up or 'Helpful' button with an upvote count. Tapping it calls a backend `upvoteAnswer` mutation. A user can only upvote an answer once (toggling removes the upvote). Display the upvote count next to the button.

Add a backend `upvoteAnswer` function in backend/main.mo that accepts a comment ID, toggles the caller's upvote on that comment (adds if not present, removes if already upvoted), and updates the comment's `helpfulCount` field (Int). Add a `helpfulCount: Int` field to the Comment record and a stable data structure tracking which users have upvoted which comments. Return `Result<Int, Text>` (the new count).

Add a 'Suggested Users' panel to the Home Feed page (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx). Display a horizontally scrollable row of suggested users to follow (users the current user does not already follow) near the top of the feed, above the post list. Each card shows the user's avatar, display name, username, and a Follow button. Fetch suggested users via a `useGetSuggestedUsers` React Query hook calling the backend `getSuggestedUsers` function.

Add a backend `getSuggestedUsers` query in backend/main.mo that returns up to 10 UserProfile records for users the caller does not already follow, excluding the caller themselves. Select suggestions by returning recently registered or most-followed users.

Add a notification badge on the Messages icon in the TopBar (frontend/src/components/TopBar.tsx) when there are unread messages. Fetch the unread message count via a `useGetUnreadMessageCount` React Query hook that polls the backend `getUnreadMessageCount` function (every 30 seconds). Display the count as a small amber badge overlaid on the messages icon. Clear/hide the badge when the user opens the Messages page.

Add a backend `getUnreadMessageCount` query in backend/main.mo that returns the count of messages received by the caller that have not been read (i.e., received after the caller's last-read timestamp for each conversation). Add a `markConversationRead` function that updates the last-read timestamp for a conversation when called, so the unread count resets for that thread.
Turn the landing page into a flash/intro animation with pictures of modified import cars â€” display a sequence of car images as an animated intro before showing the main login screen.

Always show the flash intro/landing page on app load, even if the user already has an existing account/session. Do not skip the intro for returning authenticated users â€” every visit should play through the intro sequence before proceeding to the main app.

Add a clickable image/banner on every page (all authenticated routes) that links to https://bullboostperformance.com/?ref=xprbexxu, opening in a new tab. Styled consistently with the app's automotive theme.
